resources.string: Bangladesh Sweden Polytechnic Institute (BSPI) is one of the famous and well reputed technical educational institute in Bangladesh. It was established at Kaptai under Rangamati Hill Tracts in 1962 by the initiative of Swedish Government as Swedish-Pakistan Institute of Technology. After emergence of Bangladesh, the institute renamed as Bangladesh Sweden Polytechnic Institute. The total campus area is 30.95 acre. BSPI is one of the Government institute under ministry of education through Directorate of technical education while the academic program is controlled by the Bangladesh Technical Education Board (BTEB). It offers 4-years (8 Semester) Diploma-in-Engineering courses. It has qualified teachers, workshops and laboratories with modern equipment. About 2300 students are now studying in different technical fields of this institute.

Home District : Rangamati
Education : B.Sc. in Technical Education(Civil Engineering)
Govt. Job Joining Date : 1993/02/16
Current Institute Joinning Date : 2019/05/30
Mobile : +8801827557761
Email : principal.bspi@yahoo.com

1.The academic council shall consist of the Principal, Vice-Principal, Departmental Heads, Representative of Teachers, IDEB & Staffs association, Hostel Super, Registrar (Member Secretary). 

 2.The function of the council shall be to initiate and formulate all educational policies governing the operation of the Institute.

 3.It's function shall also be to determine policies concerning,


 	 a.Standards, qualifications, and procedure relating to the admission of students.

 	 b.Students conduct, Discipline.

	 c.Students academic standards and requirements.

 	 d.Instituteâ€™s examinations and promotions.

The administrative council shall consist of the Principal, Vice Principal, All Departmental Head, Security officer, Representative of Teachers, IDEB and Staffs association, Hostel super, Registrar and Office Superintendent (Member Secretary).

The Principal presides at all council meetings.

The Council may recommend to the Principal such rules and regulations as will facilitate the administrative operations of the Institute, bring about closer correlation of its various departments and divisions, and improve the quality of all phases of its work. 

 The council may include, if necessary, representative from other areas of activities.

Section : Principal office
